page.title: 15AMENITIES
page.content: The{Well House}was made in the drought of 1921, it was given to Broughton by John Trude Fripp in memory of his son who was killed in action at Loos. It is not used any more, but could be in an emergency. { Fripps Acre}was made and given by John Trude Fripp in 1930 to be "a playground and general resting place". {Broughton Sports Field}is used for Football, Cricket, Tennis and The General Fund Fete. The{pavilion}is also used by the Playgroup. The{Dowse Room}(an old schoolroom), is used for meetings and the first rounds of the village quiz. The{Village Hall,}built in 1925, has a stage and seats about 120 people; it is used for many public occasions. Adjoining the hall is the committee room and the kitchen.
